body.name: BLACK+DECKER 12 Cup Thermal Programmable Coffee Maker with Brew Strength and VORTEX Technology, Black/Steel, CM2046S
deliveryMessages: Or fastest delivery Thursday, February 15. Order within 1 hr 19 mins
FREE delivery Monday, February 19. Order within 8 hrs 4 mins
features: 4 Layer Vacuum Sealed Thermal Carafe - The large capacity carafe keeps coffee hot for up to two hours** with our 4 layer vacuum sealed thermal carafe: stainless steel exterior, insulating vacuum seal, copper coating, and stainless steel interior.
Vortex Technology - The exclusive showerhead design evenly saturates coffee grounds, resulting in rich flavor extraction for maximum flavor.
No-Drip Perfect Pour Spout - Don’t put up with annoying spills. The carafe spout is designed to prevent spills and drips while pouring.
Programmable Brewing - Easily program the 24-hour auto brew feature so you can wake up to a fresh pot of coffee.
Brew Strength Selector - Customize your cup with an option for slowing down the brewing process for stronger coffee.
body.description: Keep coffee hot for up to two hours** with the BLACK+DECKER™ 12-Cup* Thermal Programmable Coffeemaker. The thermal carafe features a four layer vacuum seal to maintain optimal temperature for up to 2 hours**. The vacuum seal locks in heat while staying cool to the touch. The Vortex™ Technology evenly saturates coffee grounds for full and rich flavor extraction using optimal water temperatures. Plus, you can customize the brew to fit your tastes. The easy-to-use digital controls include a delay timer and the option for a stronger brew. As an added feature, the LCD display includes a fresh brew timer that indicates how much time has passed since the coffee was brewed, up to 120 minutes. *cup equals approximately 5 oz. (varies by brewing technique) **Keeps coffee 154°F or hotter up to two hours

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 27, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Changed over from Keurig
reviews.reviewText: I bought this coffee maker for my family of four, who all drink coffee at this point. We had a Keurig, which provided our family with ease of making only 1 cup at a time, on demand, but figured out we were spending so much money on Kcups. With inflation and the cost of groceries, we needed to make some adjustments to our budget. We found this coffee maker on sale on Amazon and thought this could help us out a lot! The coffee pot arrived on time. The coffee pot is programmable for a denatured brew, has a clock, and you can choose from your regular coffee brew or a strong coffee brew. The carafe is stainless steel. The carafe keeps the coffee hot for an hour after brew, and luke warm throughout an 8 hour day. The directions did state that if you put boiling water into the carafe before brewing, it would stay hot longer, but I like the delayed brew to much to do that.The coffee maker does what it is supposed to do and good quality with a good price tag!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 14, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars We are loving the CM2046S!
reviews.reviewText: I am a diehard review reader when I am shopping for something, so I thought that I’d share our review of this Black And Decker coffee maker. Firstly, we’ve been using a percolator for years because our last two coffee makers had glass pots with hot plates, and over time the hot plates had gotten all scratched and looked bad even after I tried to clean them. Burned on “stuff” and I don’t know what else drove me crazy. I eventually pulled out the percolator that we’d had for a long time, and honestly, although it worked fine, I wanted a change.Enter my search for a coffee maker with a thermal carafe since no hot plate is needed, and after hours of research I decided to give this one a try. I should add that my husband and I are kind of coffee snobs in that we like our coffee robust, black and on the stronger side. He likes his hot, so I was a bit concerned about this carafe.The first night I pushed the “strong” button, and after reading reviews, I told my husband to run the empty carafe under hot water prior to brewing to ensure hot coffee. He gets up for work well before me, so there is at least an hour after the coffee is made before I pour my first cup. Day 1 coffee was hot and very good.For day 2 and until today we haven’t used the “strong” feature, and it honestly hasn’t made a difference. Brewing time is a little less not using it (about 15 minutes), and overall it’s quiet. We have both commented that the coffee tastes better than with the percolator. I should add that I purchased a stainless steel coffee filter for Black and Decker machines here on Amazon.It’s winter as I write this, so for now he will continue to run the carafe under hot water to help keep it hot, but as the weather warms up we are going to try to not do that. The coffee stays hot in the carafe, which was one of my concerns. In fact the first day I poured the remaining coffee into a cup at 2:30pm (he had brewed it before 6:30am), and it was still lukewarm. So hot coffee has not been an issue. We leave the carafe sitting on the countertop after brewing.Overall I am very happy with this purchase. I went back and forth on the two models listed here and ultimately chose the CM2046S. Yes, it would be nice if the clock had back lighting, but it’s not an issue for us. And as far as cleaning….when it comes time I’ll run vinegar water through it.I definitely recommend this coffee maker!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 7, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Great value; great cup!
reviews.reviewText: tl;dr: Can't beat it for the price. Disclaimer: I have only used it one time. But I was so impressed, that I felt like writing a review. I am not a full-blown coffee snob, but I do all the things: fresh beans, ground daily in a burr, filtered water, proper ratio, etc. I also prefer a carafe vs a hotplate for all the reasons you already know if you're looking here.I've had a Melitta for 7+ years & it was time to upgrade. I agonized over the replacement decision since I love coffee so much but wasn't interested in spending $200-300. I would spend that kind of money if I felt it was worth it, but many models (Moccamaster for example) got spotty reviews. So I decided to try the B&D since. I figured its $60 so if it sucks, I can move on. So far, I am very impressed. Why?- Brews hot! I put a thermapen in the first pot & it registered ~195. This is key.- Brews fast!- 3 hours later (!) it is ~160.- I just used the permanent filter basket (included) the first time & got no grit. Delicious taste. It was a bit of a pain to empty after but that can be solved by using a paper filter, so not a knock on the maker.There are 2 very minor reasons I can't give it 5 stars:- It doesn't automatically turn off after a cycle. I guess it doesn't really matter, since nothing is hot or really happening. But it should shut off. My Melitta did.- The top of the carafe is a little goofy to take on and off. Maybe I just need to get used to it but it is more complicated than my Melitta.But all in all, for $60, this is a BUY!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 20, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I love hot coffee! This pot creates hot coffee from the start, however cools down after two hours. But, compare to our previous Mr.Coffee pot it is so much hotter! I did a test.Black and Decker starts at 193 degreesMr Coffee 171 degreesAfter 1 hour Black and Decker 174Mr Coffee 159At 2 1/2 hours Black and Decker 160Mr.Coffee 153Aside from temp, it’s quiet, easy to program, and looks lovely on the counter.A bit of advice to keep it hot longer. After brewing remove from stand so hole in top stays closed. There is no warming plate. Just let sit on counter and pot stays pretty hot!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 19, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Easy to use and care for, brews a great pot of coffee
reviews.reviewText: The water reservoir is large and easy to access for a no-spillage filling of the machine. Coffee basket easy to remove and clean. Carafe has an easy to use top that locks easily in place. Compact footprint and attractive designed front. The display for clock and brew status is not backlit and a little on the small side that’s my only complaint.

Our old one was acting up, so we bought an updated version. Keeps coffee pretty hot, but like any thermal carafe, without a burner, it eventually cools down. Still, we usually go through it before it gets the chance. A couple of strength settings, along with a 2-4 cup feature, programmable timer and a cleaning feature, make this a versatile coffeemaker.
Excelente calidad a buen precio el único detalle que no me gusto es que hay que utilizar filtros desechables
Excelente cafetera.. muy facil de usar..me gusta que la boca de la cafetera sea ancha lo que permite limpiarla de manera.facil..funciona de maravilla

reviews.reviewTitle: Buenos materiales y fácil de usar.
reviews.reviewText: La cafetera es de materiales resistentes, el vaso mantiene el café caliente por buen tiempo. El filtrado del café es muy bueno.

reviews.reviewText: This is a lovely machine but unfortunately is not UK compatible
